intro: Aellenia iliensis, commonly known as the Ili Valley bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Aellenia iliensis is noted for its compact stature and is often found in high-altitude meadows. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
